storyInfo: The inhabitants pile onto the beach to listen to the bishop's sermons. Skadi finally locates Gladiia, who asks her to ascertain what she truly wants. As she watches the inhabitants enjoying the food and the gradually nearing sea monsters, Skadi rediscovers her mission as an Abyssal Hunter.

attributes.text: The beach is lined with food.
The wishes of the masses have been answered by the sea.

attributes.content: Fins.
attributes.name: Male Inhabitant D

attributes.content: Shells...
attributes.name: Male Inhabitant C

attributes.content: Edible.
attributes.name: Male Inhabitant D

attributes.content: Yes, it's edible.
attributes.name: Male Inhabitant C

attributes.content: More... more... more...
attributes.name: Male Inhabitant D

attributes.content: I spilled some.
attributes.name: Male Inhabitant C

attributes.content: Pick it up. Swallow it. More...
attributes.name: Male Inhabitant D

attributes.content: Take them. Take them back.
attributes.name: Male Inhabitant C

attributes.content: Take them back. More and more.
attributes.name: Male Inhabitant D

attributes.content: Priest...
attributes.name: Male Inhabitant C

attributes.content: Priest.
attributes.name: Male Inhabitant D

attributes.text: They stop for a moment and look up at their brother.

attributes.content: My brothers and sisters, enjoy your breakfast.
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: This is a reward for our good deeds. Because we prevailed against our hunger and illnesses, we become more faithful, more united, and more harmonious with one another.
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: I'm surprised you don't ever get tired of putting on that show when you do it at practically every city you visit.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Show? Hardly. It is a joy to share His greatness and benevolence with the unenlightened across the lands.
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: They don't understand a word you just said.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: All of us are one and the same to the vast ocean.
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.text: The bishop lovingly taps the arm of a man who is stuffing his mouth full with food.

attributes.content: Come, dear brother. Share these fins with your suffering brethren. You must understand. This small piece will grant him satisfaction, which will in turn enrich your soul.
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: As for you, you must thank your brother. Thank him for giving you what could have been his.
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: When the two of you stand together, hand in hand, shoulder to shoulder, you share your life with each other, and that makes you ever more powerful.
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: Thank you... Father... sir.
attributes.name: Male Inhabitant D

attributes.content: Very good, dear child.
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: The promise isn't between you and it. It's between them and it with you as their intermediator.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Promise? No, a promise is mutual. These suffering souls are far from able to satisfy the needs of the sea.
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: The sea grants them their desires, and I help them so that their voices are heard.
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: As you already count yourself a part of us, you must know the rules.
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: Please forgive my negligence. There are certainly more suitable turns of phrase. You are using their flesh and blood to lay down the path to what it is you want within the chapel.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Whichever the case, you don't need to show up here personally every time.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: How do you know what I want?
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: It's hard not to become addicted to the pleasure of superiority.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Nonsense.
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: As the sea's most faithful creation, there is nary an ounce of falsehood to my position.
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: I stand here because I wish to save them from the bottom of my heart. Without me, they would long have become a pile of rotten meat strewn across these lands.
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: Disease and starvation. As long as we can fight against these tangible enemies, they are not our most difficult hardships. Our most difficult hardships come from the deepest parts of our souls.
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: When we find ourselves unable to fight these disasters, with destruction unavoidable, that is when we are faced with true hardship.
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: How many towns like this are still standing in Iberia?
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: This country's vast territory has long been unable to fulfill its people's needs. Nonetheless, they remain in their cramped flesh, either isolating themselves from one another or brawling.
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: Well, it's admirable that you care so much about Iberia.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: You are wrong again. It is the suffering of the people that I care about, not the borders arbitrarily drawn on these lands.
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: Isn't this in the nature of us all?
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: Bound by the limitations of our flesh and blood, it's difficult for us to break away from our obsession with ourselves by our own means, and so we choose to fight, not to understand.
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: If this goes on, even the strongest of individuals cannot escape defeat. Hardships engulf every corner. You have seen it yourself and wavered at the sight of that misery.
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: Is this necessary?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Perhaps I'm not telling you enough.
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: The truth is always worth telling, whether the listener is as foolish as you or not.
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: Perhaps we should treat this conversation as nothing more than a way to pass the time, seeing as we are working together.
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: Well, your way with words is on another level. It's no wonder so many have found themselves enthralled by your words.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: You do not yet understand. I am most sincere. I ask nothing from them. I do not believe in the power of threats either. I simply wish to point them toward a new possibility.
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: Their bodies' weakness will forever limit their cognition. You think I am ensnaring their souls with words, but the truth is far from it.
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: I am helping their hearts to hear the most basic needs of their bodies. The teachings of sages can bring nothing but brief, blind faith. The strength of the body is what grants them the right to see more.
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: There are creatures in the sea. They have no eyes, their bodies are miniscule, and they have no means of mobility. They can only drift with the tides.
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: Is the ocean that they see so different than what we see? How do creatures with no eyes grasp the holiness and profoundness of the sea?
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: You and your colleagues never understood how and where your vile yet sturdy bodies came to be, nor can you see how the weak struggle.
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: Who, then, is the truly arrogant?
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: Is it me, despite the fact I am helping them, or is it those believers of false gods, who, as the perils grow ever greater, use their words to turn true despair into false hope, to deceive and to control the pitiable weak?
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: Or perhaps—It's you and your foolish cohorts, who remain ever unwilling to face the vast sea bottoms?
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: I am sharing with them what my eyes can see so that they may broaden their horizons and know they still have true hope. They may choose for themselves whether they will rot with the land or be reborn as one with the sea.
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: Not only can this possibility save them from starvation and disease, it is also the sea's generosity for the land that insists on consuming.
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: This is not a conquest. It's understanding. It's acceptance.
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: I am pointing them in a new direction and giving them a better life. In the end, they will walk toward the truth, just as I once did.
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: This is my life's work. Your false flesh has confined your soul and left you short-sighted. You cannot see true greatness. You shall be forgiven.
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: Hmph. Sounds like they are not the only ones obsessed.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Phew, Singer, we almost missed out on this.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: There's so much food... Everyone's hungry, and we finally have something to eat.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: 1, 2, 3... I'll bring these back and grind them up. I can make soup for Grandma Petra with them. We'll have this for dinner tonight. Sound good, Bench?
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: Wgh... aogh...
attributes.name: Young Inhabitant

attributes.content: No, don't eat them like that!
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: The shells are too hard. They'll break your teeth! We have to boil them until they're soft before we can eat them.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: Singer, why don't you take some too?
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: S-Singer? What are you standing there for?
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.text: Skadi simply stares at the man named Drywall. He is on his knees, eating all that he can see on the beach.
His eyes are red. His tears have already dried up.
He is starving, and so is everyone here.
Skadi lets go of the girl.
The girl's eyes are sparkling. She cannot wait to join the crowd of feeding people.

attributes.content: Slow down, brother. This is all yours. Look around you. All this will be yours in the end.
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: Now, open your heart, accept yourself, embrace others, learn to be trusting, and learn to sacrifice.
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: The fighting has long come to an end, and the hardships will cease. Let us stand together. Our souls, flesh, and belief will grow strong, just like this eternal ocean under our feet.
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: Please allow me to keep my distance.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Oh?
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: I've been having certain... digestion issues. I'm afraid I might not be able to hold it. I'll throw up on your face.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: —Brother, you dropped your seashell. Let your brother hold onto it...
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: Interesting. You must be in a good mood today, given your choice of words.
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: Whatever you say.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: The message from the sea has you excited. You can wait for our celebration no longer.
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: Then go. Find her. Find your old friend, and share this joy with her.
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: Found you...
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.text: Skadi quickly makes it through the crowd. Her eyes are fixated on a single person.
That person appears as though she is waiting for her as well.

attributes.content: What are you doing?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Shh.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Come. Look at him.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Do you smell it?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.text: Skadi takes out a seashell.
With the seashell in her hand, she dashes toward Gladiia.
Gladiia remains calm and unflinching. She seems to have expected this.
The seashell stabs her hand, leaving no marks at all.

attributes.content: Your stance isn't elegant enough. Let me show you.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.text: Gladiia presses the seashell against Skadi's chest, pushing her up against the wall.

attributes.content: How many times have we danced together, Skadi? Twice, maybe thrice?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: You are a good dance partner.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Where is she?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: You care about her.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Should I not?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: She is rather safe for the moment.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Proof?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: I didn't know you were in the market for something so pointless.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: This is making me think your time on land has ruined your nose, Hunter.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Your whole body reeks.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Trust me. I want to vomit far more than you do right now.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: She's with you alright.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Looks like your nose hasn't gone completely bad.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Fortunately, it seems you haven't quite fallen to the level of those land-born cubs just yet. At the very least, you haven't come crying to me, asking me why I would take her away and what I am doing here.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Asking questions has never been a way of solving things. Not for us.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: 'Us?'
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: I don't even know if you are still one of us.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Looks like you have a lot of questions on your mind.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: (Strokes case)
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: If you aren't sure, you might want to think twice about picking a fight.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Otherwise, you'd just be giving your enemy an opportunity.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: You are not my target.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Then what did you come all this way for?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Don't you already know?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: You've been looking for her, but will your doubts really go away when you finally find her?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Her memory's shot. She can't tell me much.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Take a look at yourself. You are barely better than being locked in a cage.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: You may not be working for me anymore, but let me teach you one more thing.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Remember this. A hunter chases her prey because she must hunt it down. Chasing blindly will bring you only emotional comfort.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Are you so weak now that you are chasing after these phantom illusions, Skadi?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: How long has it been since you danced? You've walked too much. Your skin is very dry. Have you forgotten the proper rhythm for your breathing?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Let me ask you again. What are you here for?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.text: Skadi looks at the bishop.
The bishop stands only a short distance away. He looks at Skadi as well, his gaze piercing through the crowd.
Skadi tightens her grip on her box.
A courteous and gentle smile appears on the bishop's face. He points in a direction and gestures invitingly.

attributes.content: Not going to make your move?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: I thought you two were together?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: I don't really care.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Doesn't seem like I can say that about you, though. You are the one who needs that weight off your shoulders, not me.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.text: One by one, the inhabitants walk up to the bishop with food still in their arms. They greet the bishop as though he is truly their brother and friend.
—Just like a normal afternoon in your average Iberian town.
Skadi slowly lets go.

attributes.content: Stop with the mysteries! Who is he?!
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: I could tell you, but would you believe me?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.text: Skadi looks at the chapel on the top of the hill.
Beneath it, the bishop is waving goodbye to the inhabitants.

attributes.content: Uh... Ughh...
attributes.name: Inhabitant

attributes.content: Slowly. Careful not to trip.
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: Did you hear that? The sound of the waves. Thump, thump, thump, just like our heartbeats.
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: The food you eat and the water you drink are all gifts from the sea. My brothers and sisters, do you feel the energy in you surging throughout your body and on to your heart?
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.content: Embrace the vastness before you! This is your hope for rebirth!
attributes.name: Bishop

attributes.text: Skadi looks at the people onshore.
The crowd has started to disperse. The girl has picked a basket full of seafood. At last, she looks up from the ground and begins to search for someone on the empty shore.

attributes.content: Huh? Where's the singer?
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: I took my eyes off her for just a moment, and she disappeared again.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: *Sigh*.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: Oh well, she knows the way back. She's probably looking for her friend again.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: Let's go, Bench. Let's bring the food back.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: Uhh...
attributes.name: Young Inhabitant

attributes.content: Bench, I want to sing. Let's sing together.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: Do you remember the song that the singer sang? It's okay if you don't. I mean, you don't know how to talk. How about I sing it for you?
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: With homeland left a mile behind♪
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: Yea...
attributes.name: Young Inhabitant

attributes.content: His path lies ahead♪
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: Ahh...
attributes.name: Young Inhabitant

attributes.content: Why are you stopping me? *Sigh*. You think it's terrible, don't you? I think so, too.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: Of course I can't sing as well as the singer!
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: But if I keep at it, I will get better, right?
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: Hehe... His path lies ahead...
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: I need to go now. If I don't get going, he will be suspicious.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Captain! What are you planning?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Is it a teammate you're looking for? Why didn't you say so?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Or is it an enemy you want? If you were my enemy, you would've killed me when I tried to kill you with the seashell just now.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.text: Gladiia shakes her head.

attributes.content: You need to understand what it is that you want first. A hesitant hunter can't spot traps and will only find herself the prey of others. Is that what you want?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Singer, your eyes seem a little different.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: When you looked at us before, it felt no different from when you looked at the monsters from the sea.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: But now you are willing to teach me how to make seaweed alcohol, and you sing for us.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: Of course you are different from the monsters.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Monsters wouldn't keep pestering me to sing for them. Monsters can't even speak. Most of the time, they are dirty and dumb, and they know nothing other than to eat.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: S-So... will those monsters from the sea eat us?
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: If they are hungry, they will.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: So they come ashore for the same reason we go out to the sea. They are looking for things to eat.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: Are you sympathizing with them?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Going hungry is tough.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: I don't think that's how the ones who get eaten see it.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Right... I don't want to be eaten by the monsters like this either.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: I've never thought about it before, but now... Uh, I want to listen to your songs just a little longer. I want to teach Bench how to sing too, just like how Grandma taught me so many things.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: In that case, you need to live as long as your grandmother.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Yep! At the very least, I'm not worried about anything right now.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: And that's because... Singer, you are still here. You will help us, and fight off these monsters, like, bam bam bam!
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.text: Gladiia has left.
Skadi looks out at the sea.

Unlike the dead silence of the day before, its waters are filled with living creatures. They cling onto each other and pile on top of one another. The creature at the very top stretches out its limb. It camouflages itself as a part of the sea waves, while striking the shore's reefs with each beating wave.
Atop the hill, the chapel doors are wide open.
The people ashore have already gone home.
The monsters of the sea, eyeless as they may be, merely 'stare' at the sight.

attributes.content: My heartbeat... is getting faster.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.text: It isn't just her heartbeat. She looks at her hands and sees something that only the eyes of a hunter can see. Unable to withstand the impact of her blood flow, her skin is trembling at a high speed.
The off-key singing reverberates in her eardrums, all while the odor of the sea irritates her nostrils.

attributes.content: I see... Right.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: I am still a hunter...
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.text: A hunter chases her prey, and a hunter hunts her prey, but Abyssal Hunters dance atop the fangs and claws of their fallen prey. A hunter who has lost her partner is naturally lonely and despondent.
She is a hunter herself, and not the kind after bounties. Running away any further would be meaningless. What she must do now is to turn around and join the hunt.
They are the ones who should be afraid.
It is only now that Skadi has finally forgiven herself.
She dashes toward the Sea Terror-filled tides.
There is a stench. A stench lingers in the air of the chapel.
